snippet: A bill awaiting the governor’s signature in Tennessee could make pregnant women who use illegal drugs too scared to seek medical care.
abstract: Editorial condemns bill in Tennessee Legislature that would authorize filing of assault charges against women when their fetus or newborn is deemed to be harmed by illegal narcotics; holds bill is both mean spirited and counterproductive, and could harm babies by making women avoid seeking medical care; urges Gov Bill Haslam to veto measure.
lead_paragraph: A bill awaiting the governor’s signature in Tennessee could make pregnant women who use illegal drugs too scared to seek medical care.
